text: Carroll County is a county in the U.S. state of Maryland. As of the 2020 census, the county's population was 172,891. Its county seat is Westminster. ==Geography== The county is located in the Piedmont Plateau area. It is a mainly suburban county. In Maryland, Carroll borders the counties of Baltimore, Howard, Montgomery, and Frederick. In the North, the county is bordered by Pennsylvania on the Masonâ€“Dixon line. It borders the Pennsylvanian counties of Adams and York. ==Politics== The county is a mainly Republican county. ==Important People== Important people that come from the county are: *Francis Scott Key - the person who made the The Star-Spangled Banner, the anthem of the U.S. == References == Category:Maryland counties Category:1837 establishments in the United States Category:19th-century establishments in Maryland
title: Carroll County, Maryland
